metadata.job_to_be_done: Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.

extracted_sections.section_title: Applicable to Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Applicable to Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Multiple document support in AI Assistant

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Fill in PDF Forms Is the form fillable? Not all forms are fillable. Sometimes form creators don’t convert their PDFs to interactive fillable forms. Or, they intentionally design a form that you can fill in only by hand or with the Fill & Sign tool. These non-interactive forms are called flat forms. Fill in interactive forms An interactive form contains fields that you can select or fill in. 1. If necessary, select either the Hand Tool or the Select Tool from the context menu of the page (right-click on the page to open the context menu). The pointer changes to a different icon as you move it over a field. For example, the Hand tool changes to an I-beam when you can type text into the form field. Some text fields are dynamic, meaning that they automatically resize to accommodate the amount of data you enter and can span across pages.

Fill in PDF Forms Is the form fillable? Not all forms are fillable. Sometimes form creators don’t convert their PDFs to interactive fillable forms. Or, they intentionally design a form that you can fill in only by hand or with the Fill & Sign tool. These non-interactive forms are called flat forms. Fill in interactive forms An interactive form contains fields that you can select or fill in. 1. If necessary, select either the Hand Tool or the Select Tool from the context menu of the page (right-click on the page to open the context menu). The pointer changes to a different icon as you move it over a field. For example, the Hand tool changes to an I-beam when you can type text into the form field. Some text fields are dynamic, meaning that they automatically resize to accommodate the amount of data you enter and can span across pages.

Convert a file to PDF 1. Open the file in the application used to create it. 2. Select the Convert To Adobe PDF button on the Acrobat PDFMaker toolbar. For Microsoft Office applications, such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, select the Create PDF button on the Acrobat ribbon. 3. Enter a filename and location for the PDF, and select Save. 4. (Optional) Check View Result to open the PDF or enable Protect PDF to specify the Security settings for the PDF. Create a PDF and share the link for viewing or commenting Applicable to Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 1. Open the file in the application used to create it. 2. Do any of the following: - From the Home tab, choose Create PDF and share link. - Select File > Share > Create PDF and share link > Create PDF and Share link.

- Select File > Share as Adobe PDF link. 3. Acrobat converts the file to PDF, displays it in Acrobat, and copies the shareable link. You can share the link with the desired recipients. Create a PDF and share via Outlook Applicable to Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 1. Open the file in the application used to create it. 2. Do any of the following: - From the Home tab, choose Create PDF and Share via Outlook.

Multiple document support in AI Assistant GenAl Assistant allows users to process up to 10 documents simultaneously, including non- PDF formats (.doc, .docx, .rtf, .txt, .ppt, .pptx), each up to 600 pages and 100MB. Users can switch between documents, with responses consolidated from various sources and proper attributions. Persistent history support is also included to provide continuous access to previous interactions.
